title: Tutorial Island
notes: Welcome to Gielinor! This guide will help provide ideas on what to do next to progress your character and upgrade your gear. This is not a strict guide - feel free to do things in a different order based on preference.

title: Prayer Overheads
notes: Blue dragons are weak to water spells and can easily be safespotted in <Link="Taverley_Dungeon">Taverley Dungeon</Link>.
Using the chaos altar in the wilderness will drastically speed up the process to unlock overheads, requiring less than 100 dragon bones on average.

title: Underground Pass
notes: The Iban's staff is a decent magic weapon during the early game because <Link="Iban_Blast">Iban Blast</Link> has a higher base max hit compared to other spells on the standard spellbook.

title: Barbarian Assault
notes: The Fighter Torso is less important now with the addition of Moons armour in the game. Many players dislike Barbarian Assault and if you are one of them then feel free to skip this grind.

title: Recipe for Disaster
notes: Completion of Recipe for Disaster is often considered the start of the mid game. Congrats on your progress thus far! Time to start gearing for bosses.

title: A Kingdom Divided
notes: Completing A Kingdom Divided unlocks the full potential of the <Link="Arceuus_spellbook">Arceuus spellbook</Link> which is often the most used spellbook for bossing due to the various DPS increases you can get from it.

title: King's Ransom
notes: If you don't have enough resources to get to 60 prayer, you'll get a ton of <Link="Blessed_bone_shards">Blessed bone shards</Link> during upcoming grinds such as from <Link="Hunters'_Rumours">Hunters' Rumours</Link>.

title: Hunters' Rumours
notes: Training hunter is very fast with <Link="Hunters'_Rumours">Hunters' Rumours</Link> and provides a lot of useful items for Ironmen. It's worth doing as early in your progression as you can.
::ranged|NOTE: The rune crossbow is better than the sunlight crossbow when using enchanted bolts which you might not have for a while and are usually saved for bosses.

title: Black Mask
notes: The black mask provides a huge damage and accuracy boost while on a slayer task and will eventually be upgraded to a <Link="Slayer_helmet">Slayer Helmet</Link>.

title: Dagannoth Kings
notes: ::melee|Dagannoth Rex can be safespotted relatively easily which makes killing him early in progression viable.
::melee|A dagannoth slayer task will make this easier if you have a <Link="Black_mask_(i)">Black Mask (i)</Link> but it is not required. You can also wait until after Barrows for better tank armour.

::ranged|Dagannoth Supreme is hard to kill without aggroing the others. The ring is an extremely marginal upgrade and usually not worth going for until you have good tank armour or another player can hold aggro on the others.

::magic|Dagannoth Prime can be killed with ranged without aggroing the others but it's harder to setup. The ring is a very marginal upgrade and usually not worth going for until you have stronger equipment.
::magic|The Mud Battlestaff dropped by Prime is not required by any means but it can be convenient for grinding the <Link="Mage_Training_Arena">Mage Training Arena</Link>.

title: Mage Training Arena
notes: The <Link="Master_wand">master wand</Link> is an extremely marginal upgrade compared to the Ancient Staff but it takes quite a while to grind. It is usually not worth the effort until you can make a <Link="Kodai_wand">Kodai wand</Link> much further in progression.

title: Barrows
notes: ::melee|Getting tank chest and legs is useful for various grinds. At a minimum you want tank legs since that slot is harder to get strength bonus for. Verac's armour is particularly useful for the extra prayer bonus.
::ranged|The <Link="Karil's_crossbow">Karil's Crossbow</Link> is very similar to the sunlight crossbow but it's 2h which makes it worse overall.
::ranged|The <Link="Karil's_coif">Karil's Coif</Link> is technically better but usually a Helm of Neitiznot is worn instead for its prayer bonus.
::magic|Ahrim's equipment is quite good for the mid-game because it has magic damage bonus which up until this point has been pretty hard to come by.

title: Fire Cape

timeline.title: 70+ ranged
timeline.subtitle: To prepare for the the fight cave

notes: Jad is your first major challenge in your journey through OldSchool RuneScape. At this point in your progression you should be more than equipped to take him down. It may take a few tries but you got this, good luck!

title: Arkan Blade
notes: The crush weapon dropped by Amoxliatl is useful to get before you start grinding Moons of Peril, specifically for the <Link="Blue_Moon">Blue Moon</Link>. However, this moon is considered the easiest of the three so its not strictly needed.

title: Royal Titans
notes: The upgraded prayers from Royal Titans are a huge DPS increase for your ranged and magic combat styles and will make future bosses a lot easier to grind.

title: Hueycoatl
notes: ::ranged|Hueycoatl hide armour has similar ranged accuracy to eclipse moon but higher defence and prayer bonus which makes it better when you aren't using an atlatl.

title: Slayer
notes: ::melee|Slayer should be trained in the <Link="Catacombs_of_Kourend">Catacombs of Kourend</Link> as much as possible to collect <Link="Ancient_shard">ancient shards</Link> for charging and imbuing your Arclight.
::ranged|You'll get a lot of hard clue scrolls while training slayer. A blessed d'hide shield and boots are good upgrades if you happen to get them but not required.

::magic|The Warped Sceptre should be your first powered staff which does not require a specific spellbook to use. This means we can use the Arceuus spellbook to summon thralls for a flat DPS increase in any encounter.

title: Vorkath
notes: We are only killing Vorkath at most 50 times to get the upgraded Ava's device. None of the other items are worth the time investment until we have better gear.

title: Zulrah
notes: ::magic|You probably won't be able to craft the Trident of the Swamp yet since it requires 87 slayer to get a <Link="Trident_of_the_seas">Trident of the Seas</Link> from Kraken. Zulrah is still worth killing now for the ranged Blowpipe though.

title: K'ril Tsutsaroth
notes: The Zamorakian hasta is a great stab weapon for Tombs of Amascut and is eventually needed to create a <Link="Dragon_hunter_lance">Dragon Hunter Lance</Link>.

title: Tombs of Amascut
notes: We are only farming a few common items right now: the <Link="Osmumten's_fang">Osmumten's Fang</Link> is a powerful weapon for general bossing, the <Link="Lightbearer">Lighbearer</Link> regens special attack energy twice as fast, and the <Link="Divine_rune_pouch">Divine Rune Pouch</Link> stores an extra rune to maximize inventory space.

title: Slayer Cont.
notes: ::ranged|Now is a good time to start prioritizing medium clue scrolls for a chance at Ranger boots. This is something you should work towards passively over time with the hope that you'll get them by 91 slayer for Cerberus.
::magic|The chance of getting an Imbued Heart is very low, but if you happen to get lucky, then it'll be one of the best magic upgrades you can get.

title: Abyssal Demons
notes: Although the <Link="Abyssal_bludgeon">Abyssal bludgeon</Link> is a good upgrade for crush, there's not many crush-weak bosses in the game where you'll use it. Feel free to skip this if you'd like.

title: Kraken
notes: ::melee|The Kraken Tentacle is combined with an <Link="Abyssal_whip">Abyssal Whip</Link> to create the Abyssal Tentacle. Prioritize abyssal demons immediately if you haven't already.

::magic|The Trident of the Seas should be upgraded to a Trident of the Swamp using a <Link="Magic_fang">Magic Fang</Link> dropped from <Link="Zulrah">Zulrah</Link>. Prioritize this immediately if you haven't already.

title: Chambers of Xeric
notes: We are only doing Chambers of Xeric right now for the prayer scrolls since they are the most common unique and provide a massive DPS increase. The rest of the items can be farmed later.

title: Corrupted Gauntlet
notes: Many players opt to do the Corrupted Gauntlet earlier in progression because the Bowfa opens up a lot of bossing content, but the mid-game has expanded with much better gear so it's not strictly needed.

title: Passive Skilling
notes: Consider using your afk training time to level the above skills for useful resources. Do this passively over time, not all at once.

title: God Wars Dungeon
notes: ::melee|Bandos armour is the same strength bonus as Blood moon, but it provides a lot more defence. At the very least, Graardor is worth killing for his godsword.

::ranged|Kree'arra can be pretty annoying to kill without good gear so you can opt to kill him later. Armadyl armour is only a minor upgrade but you'll eventually want it to fortify <Link="Masori_armour">Masori armour</Link>.

::magic|Unfortunately there's not many magic upgrades in the God Wars Dungeon. The Staff of the Dead exists but it's really only used to upgrade into a <Link="Toxic_staff_of_the_dead">Toxic staff</Link> for PvP.

title: Colosseum
notes: At this point you have a great setup for the Colosseum. There's always better gear you can get, but that shouldn't stop you from learning. The only way to become a better player is to start sending attempts.

title: ToA: Expert
notes: ::melee|You should have already gotten a Fang earlier in progression, but if not then now is the time. Consider trying for the <Link="Cursed_phalanx">ornament kit</Link> if you are up for a challenge.
::ranged|Masori will be a considerable buff when not using a Bowfa. You'll want to prioritize farming Kree'arra afterwards if you haven't yet  so you can fortify the armour for extra defence.
::magic|The Tumeken's Shadow is generally considered the easiest megarare to get, which is why we farm this raid before the others.

title: CoX: Challenge Mode
notes: At this point in your gear progression, you should be strong enough to do Challenge Mode for a better chance at uniques.

title: Theatre of Blood
notes: ::melee|You can do a little bit of Theatre of Blood earlier in your progression to get an Avernic Defender since it is the most common drop, but a lot of best in slot weapons are 2h so it's not strictly needed.
::ranged|The only upgrade for ranged from Theatre of Blood is Bastion potions made from Vials of Blood. This is a potion that boosts both ranged and defence level.

::magic|The Sanguinesti Staff provides a passive leech effect which can be useful but it's pretty costly to use. If you only have a Trident of the Swamp, then this will be an upgrade, otherwise you probably won't use it much.

title: Nex
notes: ::melee|Torva armour gives higher max hits but Oathplate is still better DPS for slash because of its accuracy bonus, thus Torva is mostly used on non-slash attack styles.

title: Nightmare
notes: The unique drops from Nightmare are fairly niche and usually not worth farming without max gear. Most ironman only farm this boss for collection log.
